intro: Taraxacum navacerradense, commonly known as the Navacerradense dandelion, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to Spain, specifically the region of Navarre, where it grows in rocky and calcareous soils. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of stiff, hairy leaves and a yellow flowering head that produces a distinctive seed dispersal mechanism. It is a perennial species that thrives in sunny, open habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic plant within its native range.
